plugins.name: Pinterest Importer
plugins.description:
‚ú® Import Pinterest boards into Figma and FigJam

Whether you're brainstorming, creating mood boards, or gathering inspiration, this plugin makes it easier than ever to seamlessly import your Pinterest pins and boards directly into Figma.


üß© Features:

  1. Maintain board structure: Preserve the sections layout of your Pinterest boards, ensuring a smooth transition of your inspiration.
  2. Sections selection: choose which sections you want to import from your Pinterest board.
  3. Add dominant color: include the primary color from each image to enrich your color palette.
  4. High-Quality images: Import pins in high resolution, maintaining the visual quality of your inspiration.
  5. Add source link: include links referring to the image source for optimal accessibility.


ü™Ñ Why Pinterest importer is a must-have:

  1. Effortless import: Quickly import all pins from your Pinterest boards into Figma with just a few clicks.
  2. Inspiration at your fingertips: Have all your visual inspiration and ideas in one place right where you design.
  3. Boost productivity: Spend less time switching between apps and more time designing.
  4. Collaboration made easy: Share your Pinterest moodboard in FigJam for team brainstorming.
  5. All in Figma: Enjoy all features directly in Figma without any external websites or chrome extensions.


‚ùìFrequently asked questions:

What are import credits and how do they work?

Import credits are units that allow you to download Pinterest boards, where each pin costs 1 credit. You can purchase credits and use them at any time, without any expiry date or time limit.


Can I purchase multiple packages at the same time?

Yes, you can buy import credits or PRO Subscription in packages that suit your needs. We offer different options to accommodate various usage levels. You can find all available packages here.


Is there an expiry date or time limit on credits?

No, there is no expiry date or time limit on credits. You can use them whenever you need without worrying about expiration.


Can I try the plugin for free?

Yes, we offer 25 free credits so you can try the plugin risk-free.


Is there a limit on the number of pins I can import from a Pinterest board?

No, you can import as many pins as you want from a Pinterest board without any limitations.


Can I import multiple Pinterest boards at once?

Currently, the plugin supports importing one board at a time.


Can I import private Pinterest boards?

Only public Pinterest boards can be imported. Private boards are not supported.


Will GIF pins retain their animation when imported?

Yes, GIF pins will be imported as GIFs, preserving their animation in FigJam.


Do I need any additional extensions to use the plugin?

No, everything happens inside Figma. You don‚Äôt need any external websites or chrome extensions.


üì© Feedback and support:

Your feedback is important to us! For comments, inquiries or assistance, please reach out to us at support@figmats.com


üí≠ Contact us:

Join our community for the latest updates, practical tutorial, future announcements and daily inspiration.

Website ¬∑ TikTok ¬∑ Facebook ¬∑ Instagram ¬∑ YouTube ¬∑ X (Formerly Twitter) ¬∑ LinkedIn

plugins.name: Split Image Effect
plugins.description:
A powerful yet simple way to create split image effect within Figma!


‚òï Buy Us a Coffee


How to use it:

  • Select an image node
  • Tap to apply split from a list of split options - Vertical, Horizontal, Random, Horizontal Random, Vertical Random, Diagonal, Fibonacci etc.
  • Go to settings to modify - rows, columns, spacing etc.
  • Modify the base component to create beautiful splits
  • Tap on Random options to keep getting new options.


Another way to use it:

  • Select an image node & multiple shapes
  • Tap on "Split image to Selection" option to split image into shapes

plugins.name: Stable Diffusion AI Figma
plugins.description:
Our AI plugin offers stable diffusion technology for advanced image editing and manipulation. With support for features such as text to image conversion, Controlnet for precise image alignment, Img2Img for seamless image transformations, and a background remover for easy image isolation, our plugin enables designers and creatives to achieve smoother, more refined designs with greater ease and efficiency. The stable diffusion technology ensures that images are processed and edited with greater accuracy and control, resulting in high-quality designs and visual content


This tool provides similar results than what you would get using openAI dall-e (DALLE) or MID-JOURNEY (Midjourney).

plugins.name: Webpages to Figma ‚Äî Import Webpages to Figma designs
plugins.description:
Import websites into Figma to iterate, redesign, benchmark and more, without building each element from scratch.


2000+ components

Pixel-perfect capture

Light and Dark themes

multiple viewport sizes


‚û§Save time on redesigns

Recreating a site or building design elements from scratch can take hours. Webpages to Figma allows you to use any website as a base, with fully editable layers to turn into components or redesign into something else.


‚û§Improve collaboration

Webpages to Figma makes it easier to brainstorm with a website in an editable format. Your design team can change and move elements around to collaborate in real time.


‚û§Extract design assets easily

Webpages to Figma helps you extract design assets from any website, such as images and fonts, and will even create local Figma styles for you, automatically!


Need a webpage that's behind a log-in, on a private network, or a specific page state? We have a Chrome extension for that.


Install the Webpages to Figma Chrome Extension from Chrome Web Store from here:

https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/kkobkbhgkiochdjdadphhhpoipikoepd?authuser=0&hl=en-GB


Go to any website in your Chrome Browser

Invoke the extension, and then choose if you want to capture the entire page or a single component

Once the extension captures the page, save and download the page/component data

Go to Figma and run the plugin

Upload the data you just downloaded

The plugin automatically converts the data into a figma design.
plugins.tagline: Convert any Webpage into fully editable figma design.

plugins.name: Material Theme Switcher
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you to switch seamlessly between light and dark mode of your design library.


Preparation

Create a color palette with local color styles. Be sure to structure your light and dark mode colors in separate folders and that they are named identically (e.g. sys/light/primary and sys/dark/primary).


üí™ This plugin works best with palettes generated with Material Theme Builder plugin which is provided by Google's Material Design team.


Procedure

  1. Open your design library and select "Save document's color styles" once.
  2. Navigate to the design document which contains your artboards with components from your design library.
  3. Select the artboard or component you want to switch.
  4. Navigate to the plugin menu and select "Switch to dark mode" or "Switch to light mode".


Optional

You can select "Show UI" to open a minimalistic plugin UI to switch themes via button.


Repository

https://github.com/DomiR/figma-material-theme-switcher


Contributors

https://twitter.com/dom_rau

https://twitter.com/julian_ebert


ü•≥ Have fun!
plugins.tagline: Switch material theme between dark and light

plugins.name: One Click SVG
plugins.description:
Still manually editing the code for your SVG icon in your HTML editor, changing its colors and making it responsive after copying it from Figma a hundred times a day? With this plugin, you can forget about those repetitive boring actions, because it does them for you! Just select -> copy -> paste!


Works perfectly with Webflow, your favorite HTML editor, and any other website development service that allows embedding HTML code.


What does the plugin do?

With the default settings, the plugin changes the width of the icon by 100%, making it truly responsive and adapting to the size of its parent div. It also uniqueizes the ID of each gradient and mask, if your icon has one, so that the styles of one of them are not inherited by every subsequent icon.


How it works?

  1.  Launch the One Click SVG plugin.
  2. Select the icon or any other vector graphic in your design.
  3. Click the "Mono" button to copy the monochrome version of your icon. In this case, the plugin will replace all colors to fill="currentColor".
  4. Click the "Poly" button to copy the colored version of your icon without any changes in colors.
  5. Open your HTML editor and paste the prepared SVG code.


Additional settings

‚úÖ Switch OFF the width="100%" to keep the original size of your icon in pixels, exactly like it was in the design.

‚úÖ Use height="100%", max-width="100%" and max-height="100%" if you need it.

‚úÖ Switch ON "Remove Opacity" to remove "opacity" and "fill-opacity" from the code of your icon, so you can control it from your CSS rules with more flexibility.


Say thanks and support us with donations üôè

https://www.buymeacoffee.com/OneClickSVG


Credits

Idea: Maksim Lobanov, https://maks.expert

Coding: Andrei Pushchayenka, konfuzz@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Copy SVG code to buffer with one click

plugins.name: Random Fill
plugins.description:
This plugin finds all selected, filled elements (shapes, frames, groups, text layers, etc) and their nested layers and applies a color randomly from your defined color styles.


To fill with a limited palette from your styles, make sure those styles have the text "~random" included somewhere in the name. One way to easily create a limited palette, is to select all color styles you want to include, and right click "Add new folder." Name your folder "~random" and voila, the plugin will only pull colors from that folder.


Note: Name is case sensitive! Make sure to write "~random" exactly as it is here, with the lowercase "r".


Hot tip: Mac users can bind the plugin to an App Shortcut in System Preferences for quick access to iterate until you find a random combination you like.

plugins.name: Slide Deck Toolbar
plugins.description:
Turn Figma into a presentation software, like Slides, PowerPoint or Keynote. Your whole team can make on-brand presentations inside Figma with the Slide Deck Toolbar.


Live preview

See your entire slide deck in an easy-to-use sidebar with live previews, quick navigation between slides and drag-and-drop reordering. Like you are used to in other presentation software.


Create, duplicate, reorder, delete

Insert new slides in-between current slides, duplicate a slide or move a slide around with a single click using the toolbar buttons.


Use a shared template

You can optionally use a master component that will be added to all new slides. Create different designs using component variants and properties and keep everything in sync.


Keyboard navigation

When the focus is inside the plugin window or the active slide frame on the canvas, you can use the left and right arrow keys to navigate between slides.


Keep everything organized

Slides are automatically aligned on the page, renumbered when the order is changed and resized to the same size (1920x1080, 16:9) so you can be certain you haven't accidentally resized a single slide in a 80 page long presentation.



Instructions

  • To create a new presentation run the plugin on an empty page
  • To import an existing presentation rename your frames to "Slide" and make sure they are not inside a frame, group or section. NB! Your frames will be resized to 1920x1080
  • Optional - make one master slide component with variants and enable it in the Settings panel
  • Select File > Export frames to PDF‚Ä¶ to download your presentation


Contact

If you have ideas for improvements or encounter bugs I‚Äôd love to hear about them, my email is reino@reinozuppur.com


Possible improvements for the future

  • Allow configuring custom slide sizes
  • Page number text template inside slide

accepted.name: Reino Zuppur
accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.tagline: Turn Figma into PowerPoint with Slide Deck Toolbar. Manage your slides with an easy-to-use toolbar.

plugins.name: Fake it
plugins.description:
Not just English ! Not just ipsums ! No AI keys !


Insert or replace texts with random fake (but realistic) data, using Figma quick action menu (‚åòP and Ctrl-P or ‚åò/ and Ctrl-/).


Figma Help : Use Quick Actions


ü™Ñ 200+ types of data and 60+ languages from Faker.js.


ü¶Ñ This plugin is open source and open to suggestions.


Replacing texts

Depending on your selection, running Fake it will replace :

  • every selected text nodes
  • every text nodes in selected frames
  • the selected text range
  • or create a new text in center of the view


Tagging and updating

The option "Tag layer" adds a suffix to the processed layers (ex. *Person.fullName).

Running Update selected will update every tagged nodes in the selection.

plugins.name: Cannoli email builder - Figma designs into email code
plugins.description:
What is Cannoli

Cannoli effortlessly turns Figma designs into HTML and MJML code, complete with CSS styles. To make email designs compatible with Cannoli, use its naming convention and structure, which the plugin handles automatically. Check the documentation for more details.


How the Plugin Works

1. Launch the plugin in the Figma file where you'll create your email design.

2. In the "Design" tab, establish the email structure by adding sections and columns as needed. Columns can be made responsive, stacking on mobile and remaining horizontal on desktop.

3. Incorporate base elements (header, paragraph, image, button) or use pre-built components from the "Library" tab, or leave sections empty for custom elements.

4. Click "Create" to generate a new frame with your email structure and basic content.

5. Add content, images, and styles to the frame, adjusting properties like paddings and spacings. Use Cannoli naming conventions and structure when adding content (refer to documentation).

6. Convert the email design into code on the "Get Code" tab, signing up for a free Cannoli account. In the plugin, input your file's URL and select the frame for conversion.

7. Utilize Cannoli's editor for final adjustments, such as editing copy, adding links, or replacing images.

8. Export your email code by copying it to the clipboard, downloading, or exporting directly to a Klaviyo template.


Things to note about MJML structure and naming conventions

  1. Cannoli uses MJML to efficiently convert Figma designs into HTML code.
  2. Emails are divided into rows called "sections."
  3. Each section contains one or more columns.
  4. You can't nest sections or columns within each other.
  5. Content goes inside columns.


Naming:

Figma layers must have the "mj" prefix followed by the MJML tag name. Common MJML tags supported by Cannoli include mj-button, mj-image, mj-text, and mj-divider. See the full list.

Note: Anything inside an "mj-image" layer automatically becomes an image, useful for image slicing in emails.


Need Help?

If your file didn't convert correctly, we'll send a new version within 24 business hours. Meanwhile, contact hello@cannoli.app or use the chatbot.

Explore our Email Kit for example designs compatible with Cannoli.
plugins.tagline: Easily build Cannoli-ready email designs and convert them into HTML code

plugins.name: Convert To RTL (Heb + Arb) Extended
plugins.description:
* Update *

Now that Figma supports RTL, the plugin can also update old text areas that were created before, and still keep the text as it was.

Watch demo (in Hebrew) -> here.

Watch demo (in English) -> here.


Important: Plugin might be very slow/crash when running "In page" option on big files.

-------


This plugin converts flipped text that contains Hebrew & Arabic letters to RTL.


Arabic support still in testing. Let me know if you find bugs :)


It can flip:

  • All the texts inside the page
  • The texts in the selected object
  • A selected component and all it's instances


How to use:

  1. Run the plugin
  2. Choose what to convert
  3. The text boxes inside the selected object/s will be updated


Important note:

The plugin does not support texts will multiple styles.


Feel free to contact me for any bugs you find.

plugins.name: HCL Color
plugins.description:
The HCL color space equalizes the apparent lightness of hues and allows for better control over contrast. 


This helps to convey meaning with color, for things like data visualization, where using regular HSV/L may lead to seeing patterns that aren't there because hues have different lightness, and our brains give lightness priority over hue. It also helps eliminate unwanted surprises should your work be viewed in B/W (printed etc.)


C is colorfulness. Its numeric value is somewhat arbitrary, so I normalize it to 100% at the edge.


The underlying color space is okLab (default), Lab or Luv. The contrast ratio is calculated according to WCAG 3 (default) or WCAG 2.


Clicking a swatch copies its hex value to the clipboard. Shift locks dragging to one axis. The arrow keys move the selected handle in small increments (hold Shift to move both handles). Alt R / ‚å• R resets the plugin to the default state.


Color blindness can be simulated with the three rings in the top right corner. Each ring will cycle through Normal->Weak->Blind (the center dot includes blue-mono and mono). Holding Shift will toggle Normal<->Weak, holding Ctrl / ‚åò will toggle Normal<->Blind.
plugins.tagline: HCL color picker

plugins.name: Dots on Vertices
plugins.description:
This plugin places a customizable dot on every vertex of selected vectors with surgical accuracy.


It can be tedious having to manually place individual dots to their exact spot on a vector shape. I've done that so many times, and I was unhappy with them being just a tiny bit off the center. So I wrote this plugin, and I hope it helps you as much as it helps me.


Usage:

------------------------------------------------------

  1. Select vector layers, and run the plugin
  2. Make the dots your desired styles
  3. Change the dot radius by scrubbing the 'Padding around items' in the auto-layout panel


Feature Updates:

------------------------------------------------------

December 30th:

  1. Now you can re-run this plugin on any vector to update the dots
  2. You can now select multiple vectors simultaneously and run the plugin


December 28th:

  1. Drastically simplified layer structure for dots, taking full advantage of auto-layout v3
  2. Dot are now componentized, for better extendability and easier management

plugins.name: Change Image in Instance
plugins.description:
Change images in instances without detaching them.


Super easy to use

  1. Select image layer in instance
  2. Hold "Shift‚áß" on windows or "Command ‚åò" on Mac
  3. Select the image you want to insert into the instance.
  4. Run "Change Image in Instance"!!

That's it!!


Tips:

Works best if image sizes are same,

if not

  1. mask input image with shape (of same dimensions) of target image.
  2. Copy masked image as PNG by "‚åò Command + ‚áßShift + C" for mac or "Control + ‚áßShift + C" for windows.
  3. Use the PNG version of the mask and run the plugin.
plugins.tagline: Change your place holder image in component instances without having to detach your component.

plugins.name: gridissimo-converter
plugins.description:
Generate grid styles via gridissimo.jamillazarev.com


Buy

https://jamillazarev.gumroad.com/l/gridissimo


Usage

  1. Generate grids using https://gridissimo.jamillazarev.com/
  2. Click "For Figma" in the upper right corner
  3. Run the plugin, Paste & press "Generate styles"


Keep in mind

  1. A short link, properties & CSS will be attached to style in the description.
  2. The plugin knows what you have already generated ‚Äì you don't need to reconnect the styles if you don't change names. Just paste the new URL into the plugin.


Demonstration

https://youtu.be/_UT4lAe3Ei0

accepted.description:
